title: The Chump
description: Michael continues to see Donna even after learning she's married and meeting her husband, Dwight and Angela take their baby contract to an arbitrator, and Jim and Pam struggle to stay awake at the office.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: This here is a radon test kit. [holding out tiny cylinder disc] Okay I will be putting 'em everywhere. And... please don't throw these out. [starts snapping towards Michael's face] This is a radon test kit. [continues snapping] Please don't throw these out. [Michael gives annoyed look] See them all over the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Toby has been leaving radon kits everywhere, like he owns the place.  The first time I threw mine away, I thought it was an ant trap. [finds radon kit in between his blinds in his office] But I figured I'd rather live with ants than with his creepy little disc. [throws it away] The second time... I thought it was one of those, you know, those things you turn over and it moos. [finds another radon kit on top of his cabinet] Like a cow thing. But upon closer examination, it was another ant trap, so I threw it away. And the third time... I did it out of spite. [takes radon kit from the top of the blinds of his office window and slams it into the trash can]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pfffffttt.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Come on, Michael. You're interrupting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You're kidding me? God! You say radon is silent, but deadly, and then you expect me not to make farting noises with my mouth? What is this?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Please sit down.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? We're not gonna die of radon, we're gonna die of boredom.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: YEAH! [laughter]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right? And if I had a gun with two bullets and I was in a room with Hitler, Bin Laden, and Toby, I would shoot Toby twice.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: No. No!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's... not okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You were being really funny, and then you went too far.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would kill Bin Laden and then Toby.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, hmmm... that's still...

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Mm-mm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay geniuses, how would you do it?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Curve the bullet. Like in my favorite James McAvoy film, Wanted.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: All that does is help you shoot around things. What does Bin Laden...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Is there a curtain rod in the room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: How about make-believe land has anything you want?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Stanley, please, this is serious!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is this the thing where they use an icicle so there's no evidence?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, we stab Toby through the heart with an icicle.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, the whole two bullet thing is a red herring. Here's how you do it:

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What flavors did you get? [yawns]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: It's so exciting Pam. The Eagles are doing a theme of ice creams in honor of turning 60.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [reading flavors] Despera-dough. Witchy-womanilla. Why do they do this?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Do you want me to go back to the store?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, no, no, it's fine. I was just commenting. We gotta get these out, open 'em up.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: This is all for Michael. It turns out his girlfriend was married.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, and when Michael gets a broken heart, this whole place comes to a halt, so we're just trying to get out in front of this.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: After his last breakup, he ate 40,000 calories in three hours. Right, Pam? That's what Pam told me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [yawns] Yeah, or no... well... I don't know. I'm sorry. I was up all night with Cece, otherwise I'd be running this.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: That's okay. You probably shouldn't keep a baby up that late, though.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We have Mr. Bean playing in the conference room and the Pink Panther movie in his office. With half hour shifts to watch it with him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we need bodies in both these rooms, people. So please sign up.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: He's coming.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, okay. Everyone, remember, when he get's like this, he will wallow, if you empathize. Keep conversations light and if you get stuck, and you don't know what to do, make a random sound effect okay? Farting noise, whatever. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [walks in] Hey everyone.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, out! Get out now! Leave now.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Leave, get outta here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Leave!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right now!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, and if he makes a joke, just laugh it up, no matter what. Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks in] Morning everyone.

quotes.speaker: Everyone
quotes.text: Hey! [applauses] Hey, hey!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hi Michael. [gives him a hug]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hello!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Michael, nice tie or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. It's reversible, I think. [everyone laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's hilarious.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's awesome. You want some ice cream?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh! Oh wow, are those Eagles' flavors? Cake it to the Limit. That's my favorite! I love that! Too much for me to have by myself. Anybody wanna share?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Boi-oi-oi-ing

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Well... that's random. I will dig into those later.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: I don't follow this exactly. Uh, "The Descendants of any replicants from this union shall have..."

quotes.speaker: {Dwight} and {Angela}
quotes.text: Joint custody

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Are we talking about your grandchildren?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Rather than spend all day in court, we've decided to settle our dispute using a mediator. It was an option spelled out in our childrearing contract.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alleged contract.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Alleged? I'm going to own your farm by the time this is over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just try. I will do legal jujitsu on you. Gyah! [pretends to karate chop her neck] See, don't even need to make contact. The law will do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So much of this is just impossible to verify. Item five, point "B", uh... the beet juice cleanse?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm doing it. You know I am. It's disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How do we know this? I'd like to see a stool sample.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Dwight, look at my teeth. [shows teeth, beet red]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Eughh. [looks disgusted]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No secret crying. Hasn't even opened the tissue box in there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Could he still be seeing her?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I don't think he'd do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So we're gonna say the most likely scenerio is that Michael matured overnight?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, it happened to Tom Hanks in Big.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Exactly. It happened in Big.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I gotta go. Text me later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm really too tired to do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Me too!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Then let's just not do this. Do you have any idea the risks involved?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We were wondering if you would like to have dinner with us tonight, in our home, and play with our baby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can order in from Hooters.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, Hooters to go. Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We can watch a movie and play Rock Band.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Billy Joel Rock Band.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That... exists?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, I'll have to take a rain check, but thanks for the offer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [shouts] Michael Scott, are you still seeing Donna?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Pam... she's not invisible so stop asking silly questions.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Since when is this an office where we delve into each other's personal lives?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I like Donna. Is it wrong to keep seeing her? Depends on who you ask. I mean, if you ask her husband... or you took a random poll, yeah, it's wrong.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: That is something I would never do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I think we all know what you're capable of Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey, I have never cheated on, been cheated on, or been used to cheat with.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I ask... everyone in the room, "Are you in a relationship?".

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People, this is Scranton. And many people consider that to be the Paris of northeastern Pennsylvania. And in Paris, it is rude for a woman to have less than four lovers.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Eughh, Ryan, I do not want you hanging around Michael anymore.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I will have you know that I asked Donna about this and she is fine with it. And just to be sure, I asked her again afterward. Same answer.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How does he feel about it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He is never gonna find out. He is a high school baseball coach. He wakes up early. He goes to bed early. Look at how long it took for him to find out. [points to Andy] It was right under his nose. I had to tell him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now you're just being hurtful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm sorry, it... why is it okay for Stanley to cheat or for Phyllis to cheat...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On her diet! He's a sports guy. He's scummy. Dogfighting. Drugs. They spit.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did Donna tell you that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Real sports with Bryant Gumble.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So you're just making a giant assumption. You don't even know the guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what? You know what? I am declaring a moment of silence right now. Ten minutes of silence honoring Michael Jackson. just sit there and think about Michael jackson.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My name is Andy Bernard and I am a cuckold. For those of you unfamiliar with William Shakespeare, a cuckold is a man whose woman is cheating on him. I've lived the part. And let me tell you, I'd so much rather play the part on stage.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So... here's the thing about infidelity.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm, no, when are you people going to stop casting the first stone? I am not in the wrong here. I am the good guy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How does that work?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you think this husband is a super sweet nice guy? Do you think he's an angel? I don't think so. Why is his wife going off and having a little something-something with me? There has to be a problem with him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: In any cheating movie, the person getting cheated on is the hero. You're Ali Larter, I'm Beyonce.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am Beyonce always.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not this time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This guy's a high school baseball coach, right? Let's go check him out, see what a horrible person he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would love that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. Those teams have games and practices every day. Let's go check it out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have work to do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, really? I thought you were the boss.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's go. [starts walking towards the elevator] I can't wait to see this jerk who is making me cheat on his wife. I should punch him in the nose for what he's making me do to her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [humming Call to Post] Bum bum BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM BUM bum bum

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Andy, please.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Baseball!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh! Try not to draw attention, please. That's him. That's him.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right there. The coach!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stage right or stage left? I played batboy in damn yankees!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right there. Look, look. Follow my finger. Okay? see? The grownup by the base?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [announcer's voice] And Now, coaching third base with two arms, two legs, and no heart. Capable of feeling pain.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. Can you just- can you just act normal for a second, please?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whatever. I'm the one blending in.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [ahem][Pam snores] Guys?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm. Hey. Oh, hi, Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Can you two please join me in my office? Now.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You were supposed to be the Lookout.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, well it's really warm in here. It's like a sleeping bag.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I don't wanna be the heavy here, but honestly, guys, this makes us all look bad.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sorry about that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So embarrassing.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Good. Okay. End of the dressing down. I just hate that part of the job, you know, the power dynamics.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you were surprisingly restrained.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We will be well-rested tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Okay. That's great, actually, because I wanted to talk to you about something else.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Excellent. Go for it.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I'm sure you got my email about the printer fires. The one with the branching decision tree? I actually designed that chart. Kinda hoping it catches on. [Jim and Pam struggling to stay awake] Anyway, the question is, what is the best way to disseminate important information in an efficient way?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right? So, uh, let's uh...

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Finally there's a provision here in the occurrence that the child is born an old man, a la Benjamin Button.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Same page. Go to the next one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Same page. Just keep moving.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Despite the provision covering whether this is all part of the matrix-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which we can't know.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: This is essentially...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unless we're unplugged.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Equivalent to a donor or surrogate contractor.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And wake up in the future.

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Which is actually pretty common. So I have to tell you that this is a solid contract.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Look, I can't enforce that anybody have a child with anyone else.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: So essentially, this comes down to damages. Now, there is some precedence for the range of $30,000.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't have $30,000 lying around. I have it buried very deeply, and I don't want to dig past a certain someone to get it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Chase Dixon is up. Could be a big play.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have no idea what you're talking about.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know it's like cricket.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't. No, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And it's-there's- well, home plate is like a wicket.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't know. You don't- you don't know anything. Look at him. Look at him over there. High-fiving? He didn't even do anything. Kid did all the work. I bet he does that at home. I bet it's like, "Hey, Donna, why don't you wash the dishes?" "High-five, Donna." "Hey, why don't you bring me my slippers?" "Hi-five. I'm taking all the credit."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Seems pretty well liked by the team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well, that's because he's paying their salary.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You do know that high school coaches don't pay their players.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know, I know, I know. It-I'm-it- that was a euphemism.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: $30,000? There's gotta be another way.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: He has a 60-acre beet farm that is worth a small fortune.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, I will not pay.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, I have an alternative.[hands Dwight a document]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: "Intercourse to completion. Five individual times rendered at my discretion?"

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Look, I don't think that's actually legal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Agreed. [shakes hands with Angela]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Five times for $30,000? Not a bad stud fee. Better than most horses.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But not in your bed. It's lumpy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Those lumps are cats, and those cats have names, and those names are Ember, Milky Way, Diane, and Lumpy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine. Five times. [signs contract]

quotes.speaker: Lawyer
quotes.text: Look, I can't legally watch this unfold. It's coming a little dangerously close to prostitution.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I want eye contact.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do you understand how rare is that in nature?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm not some farm animal. [Dwight smirks at the camera]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great game, coach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shh! Okay, all right. Don't, don't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You guys are awesome! Best game I've ever seen in my life.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Yeah, right. You must be rootin' for the other guys.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ha. The other guys can go die.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [whispers] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Baseball! Go talk to him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. God. You go talk to him.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Shane. Great game man!

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Do I know you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Uh, just big fans. Both of us.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Are you somebody's... parents? Oh, are you guys... Kenny's dads?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ha. No. No. But we're gay for baseball. [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But I have a wife, actually, who I really love a lot.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Okay. Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. I am so into the institution of marriage.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, isn't marriage the best, you know? Two good people finding each other, getting all committed to each other. So you love baseball. What else do you love? Let's round you out as a person.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Hey, I'm really sorry, I'm just trying to... focus here on the game.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I get it, man. I love it. That's what makes you a good coach. You know, but as a fan, it just helps me enjoy the game better if I know the coach loves his wife.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: Of course. Okay? I gotta... get back to this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But real quick, I want you to meet my associate. Sheldon!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Come on, get over here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm good. Oh, my God.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get- Get over here. Sheldon, say hi to the nice coach.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sorry. I got some stomach cramps.

quotes.speaker: Shane
quotes.text: It's all right. It's all right. Keep it going.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, that was not at all what I expected. Hoo hoo! Whoo. My heart's still racing. I just looked a man in the eyes and I shook his hand. All the time I was thinking, "I'm sleeping with your wife." And you know who does that? James freakin' Bond.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, orange slices. There ya go.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Thanks, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't thank me. Thank Dylan's mom. Here you go! Oh! Ooh Hoo Hoo Hoo hoo!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why would you throw something wet at me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You love it. There ya go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Now, were those for the team?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, no, they didn't say team. They just said coal Hawks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think those were yours to take.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, then it wouldn't be the first time I stole something away from Coach Shane.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I just wanna go on record as saying that I do not condone this affair, and I went so far as to force Michael to confront the victim of his behavior.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Did you talk to him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You talked to the man whose wife you're having an affair with.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wow. That is crazy.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Was there a fistfight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. We just talked. He's very nice.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: And it didn't change your mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It did not.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Michael, that's awful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm awful, aren't I?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. That's pretty bad.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm an awful guy! Ooh!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How can you live with yourself?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am what I am, Oscar. And I want what I want. And right now, I want a piece of cake. From now on, when I'm hungry, I am going to eat whatever I am hungry for.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That is a dangerous game, friendo.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Well, because I thought that it was a book about Anthropology the store.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't know why you were in that part of the bookstore.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: 'Cause it's next to they baby section, okay?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All right, that makes more sense. You should have said that at the beginning when you said, "I read a book about anthropology."

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't really know why you're screaming at me right now.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm not scream- I'm not screaming.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's Meredith's cake. It's her birthday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't care. I have an appetite for life! [eats cake] Mmm. Mmm! Oh, god. That's Lemon.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Good for you, man. Good for you.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He takes what he wants.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You know what? I think you're attractive, and I wanna sleep with you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What about Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: You read my mind.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [quietly] Is this a joke?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's hard to live that way man. You gotta really not care what people think about you. I-I don't know how you do it, Michael, I-I-I can't be that cold.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You'll learn, baby. You'll learn.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [pressing buttons to start microwave and moves towards his crotch] I am an honorable man, and I will honor the contract. But I don't have to give her the good stuff. Schrute sperm are strong, [banging on his crotch with drum sticks] but they're no match for a grown Schrute man. [drops yellow pages against his crotch] [screaming] [chuckling] Let's see what she gets. [bouncing crotch on bike and crashes into glass door] [thud] Aah!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [Michael leaving copy machine] Uh, boss, we're out of paper.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I noticed that.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Are you gonna add any more?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: He don't give an "F" about nothin'!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have got big balls.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think I'm gonna make it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [yawning] What about an energy drink or something?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [shakes head] It gets in the breast milk. If I drink it, Cece drinks it six hours later.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it doesn't mean I can't drink it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, it does and it doesn't.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Probably shouldn't tell you this, but a lotta guys in the warehouse work multiple jobs, so... we have a place.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: A place?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: A restful location. Talk to Glen. He'll take you up in the lift.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You sleep in the warehouse?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Lightbulb's burnt out, so it's dark. And the heat from the backup generator keeps it nice and warm. Sometimes I think about it when I'm trying to fall asleep at home. But as far as the rest of the office goes, it doesn't exist, okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: For your signature. [drops document on Michael's desk]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [Phyllis avoids looking at Michael] Phyllis. Okay. Look at me. [continues to look away] Phyllis, look at- [Phyllis turns to leave] okay, that's... [chases after her] All right, all right. You know what? I'm sick of this. I'm sick of the little disapproving head shakes. If you think that's going to have any effect on me, it will not. I am going to leave right now and go to a motel to meet Donna.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Why not your condo?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Because a motel is dirty and it is sexy. Like me. And like Donna. And frankly, the stuff that we're into isn't very condo-appropriate.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, Michael, will you drop it? Everybody's spoken their mind, and no one's changing their mind.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Morgan Freeman-narrating-everything.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you want someone to stop you? 'Cause no one's going to.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nobody better try to stop me. Good. [leaves the office. door closes]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I could have stopped him.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you warmed up? [outside sliding door in warehouse]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: God, Angela, why is that always my responsibility? [zipper sound]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What did you do to yourself? [camera pans to Jim and Pam laying down in restful location]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Never mind. Just never mind.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well, it better work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, it'll work. [Jim and Pam look shocked and disturbed] Mm. Stop kissing me. It's not in the contract.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [driving in car; returns to office; grabs ice cream out of freezer] How do I feel about breaking up with Donna? Good. Moral. I feel proud. [beeping; cut to Donna who is waiting in the parking lot of the motel] Like a grownup.[Donna receives text from phone] That was not easy because I really liked her a lot. And I'm a little bit emotional right now because I know that I absolutely made the right decision. [Donna has disappointed look; cut back to Michael in his office opening ice cream] At the end of the day, we have to do what's right. And it was either living with myself or... being happy. And I picked... the... former.

quotes.speaker: Reporter
quotes.text: Michael Scott?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Reporter
quotes.text: Do you wanna make a comment on the rumors?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Umm... I have done some very bad things, things of which I am not proud. I would like to publicly apologize to... the coach and the players. And I vow to never listen to my bodily instincts ever again.

quotes.speaker: Reporter
quotes.text: I'm talking about the Sabre printers that catch on fire.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Okay. I was talking about... what do- what? What's going on?
